author: MathiasMagnus
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Install-Module AzurePSDrive -Scope CurrentUser
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

Get the module installed.

Actual behavior
---------------

### Native Ubuntu Server 18.04 PS 6.1.0-preview4
```Powershell
PS /home/mnagy> Install-Module AzurePSDrive -Scope CurrentUser
PackageManagement\Install-Package : The member 'TypesToProcess' in the module manifest is not valid: Cannot find path '/tmp/1768512940/Azure.Storage/.\Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.Storage.Types.ps1xml' because it does not exist.. Verify that a valid value is specified for this field in the '/tmp/1768512940/Azure.Storage/Azure.Storage.psd1' file.
At /opt/microsoft/powershell/6-preview/Modules/PowerShellGet/1.6.0/PSModule.psm1:2057 char:21
+ ...          $null = PackageManagement\Install-Package @PSBoundParameters
+                      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ResourceUnavailable: (/tmp/1768512940...re.Storage.psd1:String) [Install-Package], Exception
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : Modules_InvalidManifest,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.TestModuleManifestCommand,Microsoft.PowerShell.PackageManagement.Cmdlets.InstallPackage
```

### WSL Ubuntu 18.04 PS 6.1.0-preview4

Nothing is installed. Things get downloaded, but none of the folders in Env:/PSModulePath contain the uncompressed module files.

title: Installing modules does not work on Ubuntu
